I have rebelled against Anolis and created a new preprocessor that I stick before Anolis in my pipeline.

Before:

The first node of a Range is its start node, if that is a Text, Comment, or ProcessingInstruction node; or else the child of its
n data-anolis-spec=domrange title=concept-range-start>start node with index equal to the start offset, if that exists; or else its
tle=concept-range-start>start node.

After:

The first node of a [[range]] is its [[rangestart]] [[bpnode]], if that is a [[text]], [[comment]], or [[processinginstruction]] node; or else the child of its [[rangestart]] [[bpnode]] with [[index]] equal to the [[rangestart]] [[bpoffset]], if that exists; or else its [[rangestart]] [[bpnode]].
Now I will not have to want to kill something every time I write a simple sentence with cross-spec xrefs.
Probably hacking Anolis so it can automatically convert Range into Range and so on would have done the trick too.
